messages.title: LOCAL CHAMPION SELECTED IN CITY SEAT
messages.content: LIBERAL DEMOCRATS have selected local campaigner DAVID NIKEL to stand in the elections on 6th May.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Only Nick Clegg's Lib Dems will put money back in your pocket.
Councillor Ayoub Khan and David Nikel have pledged further housing investment under the Lib Dems, by renovating run-down homes.
Liberal Democrats are committed to cutting congestion. They will ensure low cost of peak travel for everyone and will introduce an economy rate young persons bus pass.

keyPolicies.policyTitle: Better access to higher education & training
keyPolicies.policyDescription: Liberal Democrats want to ensure that people have the necessary skills for well paid jobs. They will invest in further increases in the Birmingham's schools, ensure exam literacy & numeracy at age 11, and continue to build & renovate schools for the future.

mentions.tacticalSituation: The only way to kick Labour out here is by voting LIBERAL DEMOCRAT. A vote for the Conservatives or the Green Party will only help Labour!

issues.economy: The future is bleak with Gordon Brown as we will all be paying more tax to pay for his mistakes.
issues.education: Better access to higher education & training - Ensure that people have the necessary skills for well paid jobs.
issues.environment: A clean & green city - All fly tipping and graffiti is removed within 48 hours. Increase recycling rates, and expand all kerb side collections. Meet our aims to reduce CO2 emissions.

housing.content: Provide 1,000 new social homes - We will ensure that by 2011 a total of 2,150 new family homes will be provided.

politicalExperience.role: Local campaigner and someone who lives and works in the Jewellery Quarter
politicalExperience.achievements: Built a reputation for hard work and hard-working campaigning in and around the City Council.

leaflet.additionalNotes: Councillor Ayoub Khan has pledged to fight for cheaper rail fares if elected as Ladywood's next MP.
